intro: Oenothera wrightii, commonly known as Wright's evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces capsules containing numerous small seeds. Oenothera wrightii is also known for its ability to thrive in full sun and its role in supporting local pollinators.
